ygData.subject: RE: Binding in Ogguk
ygData.msgSnippet: Eight minutes - so prolly not a good plan.  You might ask a newbie oger to hold one for you and bring it to you if/when you die for a fee. But you should go
ygData.messageBody:
Eight minutes - so prolly not a good plan. You might ask a newbie oger to
hold one for you and bring it to you if/when you die for a fee.

But you should go visit Ogg, with invis and see how it actually is. You may
decide that you can selo's right by them nekkid. In fact you could even
test it - dequip your drum and run past. You should know that you can
easily out run them with a drum so once you see how easy it is without - you
will be more confident.

Sylly Songsynger
<The Pantheon>
Bard of the 40th song
somewhere on Innoruuk



-----Original Message-----
From: Reece, Tom - 25IDL G4
[mailto:g4mntofcr@...]
Sent: Tuesday, January 04, 2000 2:03 PM
To: eqbards@onelist.com
Subject: [eqbards] Binding in Ogguk

From: "Reece, Tom - 25IDL G4"
<g4mntofcr@...>

I've been thinking that the next time I fight in Cazic I
will get bound in
Ogguk. Assuming no one picks it up and takes it, I plan on
leaving a spare
flute right at the zone so I can safely get back to Cazic
without aggroing a
guard. Key issue is how long will the flute stay on the
ground before it
decays?

Galtin of E'ci
30 bard


> I love sneak. When I hunt in cazic, I bind in ogguk.
